spectrum_description: This spectrum captures the diverse viewpoints on Moldova's geopolitical orientation, particularly concerning its relationship with the European Union versus Russia, and the impact of external influences on its electoral process.

spectrum_points.label: Celebrating Pro-EU Outcome / Condemning Russian Interference

articles.title: Moldova goes to the polls under the shadow of Russian interference
Moldova denounces four forms of Russian interference in this Sunday's parliamentary elections.
Moldova's legislative elections: "$3,000 a month for anyone who protests against the government"
Relief in Brussels over the Moldovan result: "They chose democracy over Russian pressure."
52% turnout in Moldova's elections to decide between rapprochement with the EU or Russia
Maia Sandu, after her party reaffirmed its absolute majority in Moldova: "Russia has failed; it hasn't managed to buy us off."
The first results, with more than 80% of the vote counted, point to a pro-European victory in Moldova.
Moldova's Action and Solidarity Party (PAS) has won the legislative elections held...

Operation "Matryoshka": Five days before a crucial election in Moldova, Russia is accused of massive interference in the campaign

In Moldova, pro-Europeans rejoice: "Russia attempted an electoral coup but failed"

EU accession candidate: Pro-Europeans win majority in Moldovan elections. In the parliamentary elections in the Republic of Moldova, the population opted for a Russia-critical stance. The elections were overshadowed by numerous disruptions.
In Moldova, legislative elections under the sign of tension
Elections in Moldova Bomb threats against polling stations received 1
Moldova affirms its pro-European attachment at the polls

The OSCE: "Serious foreign interference in Moldova's elections." The finger is pointed at Moscow's interference. But the Kremlin believes the violations have affected the diaspora in Russia. September 29, 2025

Nicu Popescu: "The vote in Moldova is crucial. Moscow needs us to hit Kiev." An interview with the former Foreign Minister who spearheaded the EU accession negotiations: "Russia not only promotes its propaganda in our country, but brings in mountains of money every day." By our correspondent Rosalba Castelletti, September 28, 2025

Moldova at the crossroads between the EU and Moscow: "Russia wants to rig the ballot box." Parliamentary elections tomorrow will see pro-Europeans and pro-Russians side by side. The Kremlin's dirty tricks, involving interference and money, are aimed at Chisinau to attack Kiev. And the façade of the Hotel National reflects a country perpetually searching for its identity. By our correspondent Rosalba Castelletti, September 27, 2025

Moldova, pro-European success with 44.13% of the vote despite hacker attacks. Pro-Russians incite the streets. Record turnout in parliamentary elections. Bomb scares at polling stations abroad. President Sandu's party nears majority. From our correspondent Rosalba Castelletti, September 29, 2025
Moldova: Russia allegedly recruited and financed Orthodox priests to influence elections

EU, relief for Moldova's vote: defeating Russian propaganda is possible. Von der Leyen: "You have chosen Europe, democracy, and freedom. Our door is open." From our correspondent Claudio Tito, September 29, 2025

Moldova votes today, threats from Moscow: "We will not allow a NATO outpost in Chisinau." By Marco Imarisio. President Maia Sandu had already taken a huge risk last October in the referendum on EU membership. Europe's poorest country is at a crossroads.

Moldovan elections, the results: pro-Europeans largely lead with 44%. Pro-Russians at 28%: "We'll demonstrate on Monday." By Marco Imarisio. Moldovan elections results favor Maia Sandu's pro-European party, but it falls short of an absolute majority.
Moldova elections "without disturbances" and "with high turnout", despite Russian disinformation campaign
Pro-Russian and pro-EU blocs closely aligned in polls for Moldova's elections, the new stage for Moscow's hybrid war

Exclusive Moldova The great game between the EU and Russia continues, now in Moldova. It's hard to overestimate the importance of this Sunday's legislative elections in Moldova. A victory for parties close to Moscow could stall the EU accession process indefinitely. João Ruela Ribeiro 8:00 PM Save 1 comment
Mutual accusations between pro-Russian and pro-EU parties mark Moldova's legislative elections

Moldova European leaders celebrate victory of pro-European party in Moldova Ursula von der Leyen, António Costa, Emmanuel Macron and others say Russian interference attempts failed. 10:34 Save 25 comments
Pro-Europeans win Moldova elections, far ahead of pro-Russian party

Exclusive: Russia Recruited Orthodox Priests to Influence Moldovan Voters Moldovan Orthodox priests were paid by the Russian government to manipulate Moldova's elections. Christian Lowe, Polina Nikolskaya, and Anton Zverev 09:00 Save 7 comments

Bomb alerts were recorded in several polling stations in Belgium, Italy, Romania, the USA and Spain, and Moldovan authorities emphasize that they had previously warned about them, in the context of the Kremlin's influence on the vote on September 28.
Ahead of Sunday's parliamentary elections, the Republic of Moldova is facing a concerted offensive of disinformation and manipulation coming from the East.
Journalist Cristian Tudor Popescu warned about the massive influence that Russia is exerting on Sunday's parliamentary elections in the Republic of Moldova.

As the Republic of Moldova approaches parliamentary elections, the public space is being invaded by an avalanche of disinformation and manipulation orchestrated by the Kremlin. The scale of the operations makes Moldova a testing ground for Russia's latest information warfare tactics.
Ahead of the parliamentary elections on September 28, 2025, the Republic of Moldova is facing an intensification of political tensions and destabilizing activities, fueled by external influences.

The international press considers the Moldovan elections a "battle" for the country's future and writes about the tensions between pro-European and pro-Russian forces, but also about the risks of external influence.

The Moldovan diaspora will play a crucial role in Sunday's crucial parliamentary elections, as the country battles an unprecedented vote-buying operation orchestrated by Russia, which is trying to oust the ruling pro-European party, according to a report.

The elections in the Republic of Moldova were not among the priorities of American officials, said Washington-based security expert Iulia Joja. The most vocal at the UN Assembly was President Zelensky, who warned that after Georgia, Europe cannot afford to lose Moldova.

As the Republic of Moldova approaches Sunday's parliamentary elections, the authorities in Chisinau accuse an unprecedented intensification of the "hybrid war" waged by the Russian Federation against the state.

Moldovan oligarch Ilan Shor, a refugee in Moscow after being sentenced in absentia to 15 years in prison for bank fraud, accused Russian public television that the elections in Chisinau were "rigged", announcing the contestation of the results of the September 28 election.

Russia paid for Moldovan Orthodox priests to travel to Moscow and gave them debit cards loaded with hundreds of dollars upon their return home. In return, the priests created Telegram channels to influence Moldovan elections.

The Moldovan police claim to have indications that some people were promised money to participate in the protest scheduled for Monday in Chisinau, against the results of the elections in the Republic of Moldova.
The parliamentary elections in the Republic of Moldova, held on September 28, 2025, and won by the Action and Solidarity Party (PAS), led by Maia Sandu, generated a wave of international reactions.
The Information Technology and Cyber ​​Security Service (STISC) of the Republic of Moldova informs that it has blocked a wave of cyber attacks on the electoral infrastructure.

After the categorical victory of PAS, the Kremlin launched harsh criticism against Chisinau regarding the organization of the parliamentary elections and accused the authorities of obstructing the participation in the vote of hundreds of thousands of Moldovans settled in Russia.
62,000 comments from Russian bots flood Moldova's Telegram messaging app ahead of elections; every third channel spreads Kremlin propaganda.

Election day in the Republic of Moldova was marked by bomb threats and attempts at destabilization, Igor Grosu, president of the Action and Solidarity Party (PAS), said on Sunday evening in his message to citizens after the closing of polling stations.

A Washington-based research institute warns that Russia is creating conditions to generate possible violent protests with the aim of removing Moldovan President Maia Sandu from power after the parliamentary elections on September 28.

The Russian Foreign Ministry summoned the Ambassador of the Republic of Moldova to the Russian Federation, Lilian Darii, to whom a protest was expressed regarding Chisinau's refusal to accredit Russian observers to the parliamentary elections on September 28.

The Moldovan police announced that several Moldovan voters were transported from Russia in an organized manner to exercise their right to vote in Belarus. The authorities emphasize that they are investigating the case to identify and punish the individuals involved in this illegality.
Over 33% of the electorate has voted so far in the parliamentary elections in the Republic of Moldova, so the election can be considered valid from this point of view.
AUR withdraws from the electoral race in the Republic of Moldova. Democracy at Home remains alone on the unionist aisle
The parliamentary elections in the Republic of Moldova, scheduled for September 28, are being treated in the Russian press as a geopolitical event with major implications.
Authorities in Chisinau report an unprecedented mobilization of Moldovan voters abroad, in the parliamentary elections taking place today.

"We can talk about a victory for Russian propaganda in the Republic of Moldova to the same extent as we can talk about a victory for it in Romania or any other EU state," says analyst Cătălin Done. He is moderately optimistic about the pro-European course of the Republic of Moldova.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has launched an appeal to Europe for greater support for the Republic of Moldova, in the context of Russia's attempts to bring it under its influence.

USR President Dominic Fritz welcomed the categorical victory achieved by the Action and Solidarity Party (PAS) in the elections in the Republic of Moldova, which he considers "a resounding slap in the face for Putin and his friends in our lands."
The PMR Foreign Ministry accused Moldova of preventing citizens from voting in the elections.
Moldova's Central Election Commission reported 236 violations during the parliamentary elections.
Human rights activists recorded 40 incidents during the parliamentary elections in Moldova.
Media reports indicate numerous violations in Moldova's parliamentary elections
Elections without a choice: Moldova deprived the opposition of a chance to win.
Elections on the brink of collapse: Moldova stifles opposition at the last moment
The Central Election Commission of Moldova has processed 90.02 percent of the protocols.

Central Election Commission: Moldova's ruling party leads with 41.22 percent of the vote
Parliamentary elections in Moldova have ended.

Central Election Commission: Moldova's opposition has 49.54 percent of the vote after the protocols have been processed.
Gutsul called on Moldovans to vote against militarization in the elections.
Dodon: Moldovan authorities are considering canceling the elections
Moldova's Central Election Commission has disqualified the Heart of Moldova party from the parliamentary elections.
Voting in parliamentary elections has begun in Moldova.
Musk responded to Durov's post requesting blocking Telegram channels about Moldova.
The Patriotic Bloc won the Moldovan parliamentary elections at polling stations in Russia.

Moldova parliamentary election seen as test of Russian interference

Europe Moldova Elections Pro-European Party Leads (Chisinau) President Mai Sandu's pro-European PAS party led the parliamentary elections in Moldova on Sunday evening, marked by accusations of Russian interference, according to a partial count by the Electoral Commission covering more than 85% of the votes.

Europe Moldova Elections Pro-European Party Leads by a Large Margin (Chisinau) President Mai Sandu's pro-European PAS party is leading Moldova's parliamentary elections on Sunday, marked by accusations of Russian interference, according to a near-final count by the Electoral Commission.
Moldova’s pro-EU ruling party wins majority in key election, boosting country’s bid to join the EU

Europe Moldova Elections Pro-European Party Wins Parliamentary Elections (Chisinau) The victory of the pro-European PAS party in Moldova's parliamentary elections on Sunday despite pressure from Russia constitutes "a strong mandate for the accession process" of the country to the EU, President Maia Sandu declared on Monday.
Moldova’s pro-EU party pulls ahead of pro-Russian opposition in high-stakes election 7 hours ago

Europe Moldovans head to the polls for a tense election (Chisinau) Moldovans began electing their deputies on Sunday for the legislative elections that will decide the future of their country, which is neighboring Ukraine at war, between continuing on the path to the European Union or a rapprochement with Russia, with the government and the EU accusing Moscow of "profound interference."

Election in Moldova: Victory for the EU, Defeat for Putin. The small Republic of Moldova has voted – and confirmed the president's pro-Western stance, despite Russian influence. Three lessons from the election. By Christian Esch, September 29, 2025, 12:19 p.m. • 3 min. Add to watchlist

Election in Moldova: Pro-European party ahead

In Moldova, President Maia Sandu's pro-European party wins the legislative elections. The Action and Solidarity Party, in power since 2021, came in first with more than 50% of the vote, compared to 24.26% for the pro-Russian Patriotic Bloc, according to official results. The vote was marked by intimidation attempts and an "unprecedented disinformation campaign" led by Russia, according to the European Union.

Article reserved for our subscribers Russian foreign intelligence claims that NATO troops are preparing to invade Moldova Eager to bring Chisinau back into its orbit, the Kremlin has developed a vast strategy of interference in the elections of the small republic, scheduled for Sunday, September 28.
Romanian far-right interferes in Moldovan elections

Decryption Article reserved for our subscribers In Moldova, the pro-European party of President Maia Sandu wins an absolute majority in Parliament. The Action and Solidarity Party obtained 50% of the vote, according to the still-partial count, which gives it more than 51 of the 101 seats in the Moldovan Parliament. The opposition coalition, the Patriotic Bloc, called for demonstrations on Monday to contest the results in the event of "fraud."
